text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Akansha,

I am on the AWS CloudTrail
team, I am a software engineer.
Out of college, I actually worked

at a different company based
out of Detroit and Charlotte.

It was close to home, so I
kind of just started there,
but I realized that the problems

that we were facing
there were really linear.

There wasn't a lot of
input that I was giving,
and I realized that I was not contributing

to my best ability because
I had a lot more to share.
So at that point, I decided I wanted to go

for something harder,
I wanted to try to work

at a company where there was
harder problems to solve,

more of my input would
matter, more of my skill,
things I trained for.
Coming into CloudTrail, me personally,

I realized that my exposure
to so many different angles

in technology has definitely
increased threefold.

At AWS, there is this need for
independent solution building

and execution, that was
one thing I found at AWS
that I didn't find elsewhere.
At my previous experiences,

we were 10 heads looking at
one small problem, but at AWS,

we are 10 heads looking at
10 massive scaled challenges.

Being able to see your work
actually used in production,
actually used by real customers,
that's one thing I really enjoy is
you can see the impact right away.

And I can be like, "Hey, look,"
to my friends and family,
I'm like, "Hey, look what I built."

It's great, Amazon is always
documenting everything,
and I even can point and say,
"Look, the day that I released it,
(Akansha chuckling)
I released it on time."
(Akansha laughing)
(upbeat music)
